sentence.Network_en: Bob Beamon's longstanding record for the long jump was eventually broken.
sentence.Network_cn: 鲍勃·比蒙长期保持的跳远纪录最终被打破了.

sentence.Network_en: There is a longstanding prostitution trade in the port.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个港口的卖淫业由来已久.

sentence.Network_en: Longstanding poverty has been exacerbated by racial divisions.
sentence.Network_cn: 种族分化已经加剧了长期的贫困问题。

list.abs: we working on strengthening our partnerships with newer partners like Vietnam and longstanding partners like Singapore .我们正在加强与越南等新合作伙伴以及新加坡等长期合作伙伴的关系。
our longstanding view has been that GDP growth will slow to y / y at the end of the year .我们的长期看法是，中国GDP在今年年底增长将放缓到8％左右。

speculation was mounting that the star's death may be linked to his longstanding use of painkillers .推测杰克逊的死可能与他长时间使用止痛药有关。

entry.tran: 长期存在的；由来已久的
entry.def: A long-standing situation has existed for a long time.

example.ex: They are on the brink of resolving their long-standing dispute over money.
example.tran: 他们很快就能解决长期以来的金钱纠纷。

example.ex: ...long-standing economic links between Europe and much of Africa.
example.tran: 欧洲和非洲大部分地区由来已久的经贸联系

means.word_mean: 1. having existed for a long time;
